comments:
I noticed the following in my console. I was running with JDK 1.4.

Internal error logged from JDI debug model:
com.sun.jdi.InternalException: Got error code in reply: 112
        at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.defaultReplyErrorHandler(MirrorIm
pl.java:240)
        at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.request.EventRequestImpl.disable(EventReques
tImpl.java:169)
        at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.request.EventRequestManagerImpl.deleteEventR
equest(EventRequestManagerImpl.java:266)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.JavaBreakpoint.removeFromTarget(J
avaBreakpoint.java:466)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.JDIDebugTarget.removeAllBreakpoin
ts(JDIDebugTarget.java:957)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.JDIDebugTarget.terminate0(JDIDebu
gTarget.java:925)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.JDIDebugTarget.handleVMDeath(JDID
ebugTarget.java:734)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.EventDispatcher.dispatch(EventDis
patcher.java:114)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.EventDispatcher$1.run(EventDispat
cher.java:143)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1188
)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.EventDispatcher.run(EventDispatch
er.java:160)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:498)
Error code 112 is "VM_DEAD - The virtual machine is not running"
*** Bug 5902 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
I still can't reproduce this, but I can fix it based on the stack trace.

Fixed. JavaBreakpoint#removeFromTarget now checks to see if the target is
terminated or disconnected before attempting to disable event requests.

The error code is gone...but I get two VMDisconnectExceptions creating threads 
while finishing?

com.sun.jdi.VMDisconnectedException: Got IOException from Virtual Machine

It seems that JDK 1.4 creates a thread at shutdown (some kind of cleanup 
thread?). By the time we hear about its creation, the VM is already exiting.

Fixed.

JDIThread now calls JDIDebugElement#disconnected() to inform the DebugTarget of
VM disconnection. We'll use this mechanism to resolve these cases as they
appear.
